title: BBC - The Roman Mysteries (2007-2008) TVrip 2 seasons
description:
BBC - The Roman Mysteries (2007-2008) TVrip 2 seasons

IMDB - http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0808099/

Roman Mysteries is a television series based on the series of children's historical novels by Caroline Lawrence. It is reportedly the most expensive British children's TV series to date at 1 million pounds per hour.
The series began filming in June 2006 and was first broadcast from 8 May 2007. The series is divided into "Episodes", each based on one book, starting with The Secrets of Vesuvius. The stories are told in the same order as the book series, except for book 6, The Twelve Tasks of Flavia Gemina, which is transposed to the second season. Books 11 and 12 were not adapted, and the series ends with the adaptation of Book 13. Each Episode consists of two half-hour episodes. The first Episode guest-starred Simon Callow as Pliny the Elder.
On 22 May 2007, after just two episodes, Anne Foy announced on CBBC on BBC One that the show has been postponed due to recent events in the news and would return later in the year on CBBC on BBC One. Since "The Pirates of Pompeii" was about children being kidnapped, the postponement was most likely due to the then recent disappearance of Madeleine McCann. On 19 June the series began broadcasting again from the beginning.
Filming for the second season began on 13 August, 2007. The episodes are based on the novels The Gladiators from Capua, The Twelve Tasks of Flavia Gemina, The Colossus of Rhodes, The Fugitive from Corinth and The Slave-girl from Jerusalem.
The series has been sold around the world including Australia, Finland, Germany, Spain, Sweden and the USA. The second season aired first in Australia. The first season is now out on DVD.

First season series:
